# PED::GET_PED_EXTRACTED_DISPLACEMENT

## Summary
Gets the displacement (in meters) that will be applied to the given ped this frame

## Parameters
* **PED_INDEX** pedIndex
* **BOOL** worldspace: Is set to TRUE the result will be in world coordinates (absolute worldspace) If bWorldspace is set to FALSE the result will be in local coordinates (relative to the character)

## Returns
* **VECTOR**

## Description
<!-- AUTOGENERATED: Remove this line before editing -->
Gets the offset the specified ped has moved since the previous tick.

If worldSpace is false, the returned offset is relative to the ped. That is, if the ped has moved 1 meter right and 5 meters forward, it'll return 1,5,0.

If worldSpace is true, the returned offset is relative to the world. That is, if the ped has moved 1 meter on the X axis and 5 meters on the Y axis, it'll return 1,5,0.
